== Approval Application for Malaysia LoCo Team (MalaysianTeam) ==
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="float:left; margin-right: 10px;" style="border: none;"><nowiki>[[File:MalaysianTeam/ApprovalApplication/ubuntu-my-small.png]]</nowiki>
|}

The Malaysian Ubuntu portal aims to be the one stop for everything Ubuntu and for Malaysian Ubuntu lovers to gather to share, meetup and just to hang out. Embracing the humanity theme of Ubuntu, we welcome all who are interested in Ubuntu, GNU/Linux and Open Source Software in general to join us making Malaysia great for Ubuntu, GNU/Linux and Open Source.

<<BR>><<BR>><<BR>><<BR>><<BR>><<BR>>

=== Roadmap ===

* '''To be Approved LoCo Team''' - {OK} DONE - March 31, 2009 <<BR>> To get the Malaysia LoCo Team (MalaysianTeam) approved as an Approved LoCo Team. <<BR>> <<BR>>
* '''Spreading Ubuntu''' <<BR>> To spread the Ubuntu's spirit to all Malaysians as well as strengthen Ubuntu brand in Malaysia in business, education and government. <<BR>> <<BR>>
* '''Provide local supports''' <<BR>> To give / provide supports to local / Malaysian users through forum, IRC, e-mails, meet ups, etc. <<BR>> <<BR>>
* '''More Ubuntu activities''' <<BR>> To organize more events and activities such as InstallFest, workshops, trainings, meet ups and so forth not only to members but to the public as well. <<BR>> <<BR>>
* '''Involve in Ubuntu Projects''' <<BR>> To encourage members involvement in Ubuntu Project such as packaging, translations and localization (l10n), and also documentations. So far we have members already participate in various Ubuntu projects, which can be viewed from their participation in Launchpad.

=== Experiences / Efforts ===

* '''Spreading Ubuntu''' <<BR>>Members have been spreading Ubuntu to Governments and businesses throughout the country. Some of the converted companies / agencies are:<<BR>><<BR>>

** '''Balka Approach Sdn. Bhd.''' - Kuching, Sarawak <<BR>>Small company (total of 5 unit of PCs) based in Kuching has been converted from Windows to run entirely in Ubuntu and Xubuntu (for low-end machines). The main reasons for the conversion are {1} cost and {2} virus. <<BR>><<BR>>{{http://www.kuchingosc.org/data/ubuntu-balka/ubuntu-balka-01-small.jpg}} {{http://www.kuchingosc.org/data/ubuntu-balka/ubuntu-balka-02-small.jpg}} {{http://www.kuchingosc.org/data/ubuntu-balka/ubuntu-balka-03-small.jpg}}<<BR>><<BR>>

** '''Ampang Parliament Office''' <<BR>>http://www.openmalaysiablog.com/2009/03/ubuntu-usage-in-ampang-parliament-office.html <<BR>>Youtube (in Malay): http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mT9QJZTm2Ak | http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dlkvDdD9eO4 <<BR>><<BR>>

* '''Translations / Localizations (l10n)''' <<BR>><<BR>>https://translations.launchpad.net/ubuntu/hardy/+lang/ms <<BR>>https://translations.edge.launchpad.net/ubuntu/intrepid/+lang/ms <<BR>><<BR>>Some of the Ubuntu Malaysia members are actively involved with translations in Launchpad where we are translating the existing projects (in Launchpad) into Bahasa Malaysia (or Malay) for the local usage (ie. in Education, etc). * '''Ubuntu Malaysia Meet Ups''' <<BR>> We have few meet ups this year: <<BR>> <<BR>>
 '''July 2008 (13th July 2008)''' <<BR>> The second Ubuntu Malaysia grand meet up was held on 13th July 2008 at Restoran Pelita Jalan Ampang (Near KLCC). This is a quite big meet-up which is attended by numbers of active, old and new Ubuntu Malaysia Community members. * '''CD's Give Away To IIUM - 11th August 2006''' <<BR>> 150 cds of Ubuntu 6.06 LTS to one of university in Malaysia were gave to students in order to give exposure about Ubuntu.  It was given to one of the IT department and were used in some of their labs.

* '''Expos / Exhibitions''' <<BR>> Here are our invovlements in local expo or exhibitions: <<BR>> <<BR>>
 '''KCBA ICT Expo 2006''' <<BR>> (http://www.kuchingosc.org/activities/kuchingosc-at-kcba-ict-expo-2006/) <<BR>> This activity is carried out by members of Ubuntu Malaysia in East Malaysia (Sarawak) under the name of <nowiki>[[http://www.kuchingosc.org/|Kuching Open Source Community]]</nowiki> (a local open source community) during the KCBA ICT Expo 2006. In this event, we setup few computers with Ubuntu Linux for public to hand-ons and try out as well as Q&A session for those who would like to know more about Ubuntu Linux. We also presenting a talk on introduction to Ubuntu Linux to the visitors. <<BR>> <<BR>> {{http://www.kuchingosc.org/data/kuchingosc-at-kcba-ict-expo-2006/booth06.jpg}} {{http://www.kuchingosc.org/data/kuchingosc-at-kcba-ict-expo-2006/booth02.jpg}} {{http://www.kuchingosc.org/data/kuchingosc-at-kcba-ict-expo-2006/booth03.jpg}} {{http://www.kuchingosc.org/data/kuchingosc-at-kcba-ict-expo-2006/booth08.jpg}} {{http://www.kuchingosc.org/data/kuchingosc-at-kcba-ict-expo-2006/booth09.jpg}} <<BR>> For the rest of the photo, please visit http://www.kuchingosc.org/gallery/kcba-ict-expo-2006/

* '''Security Session HITB - 2005''' <<BR>> 600++ cds were distributed to participant in order to give some exposure to them about the existence of Ubuntu Linux.  It was held on 26-29th of September 2005 in Kuala Lumpur.
